===Pronunciation===

===Noun===
{{ja-noun|かま}}

# a [[sickle]]
# a [[sickle]]-shaped [[weapon]], such as a [[polearm]] with a sickle-shaped blade, or a {{m|ja|鎖鎌|tr=kusarigama}}
# short for {{m|ja|火打鎌|tr=hiuchigama}}: a [[striker]] for lighting [[fire]]s {{qualifier|from the way that pieces of a broken ''kama'' blade were used for this purpose}}
# {{lb|ja|sort=かま|slang}} a [[perverse]] or [[bent]] [[tendency]] or way of [[thinking]] {{qualifier|from the way a ''kama'' blade bends}}
# {{lb|ja|sort=かま|slang}} a [[person]] with a [[perverse]] or [[bent]] [[tendency]] or way of [[thinking]]
# a category of {{m|ja|家紋|tr=kamon||family crest}} featuring a sickle
# {{lb|ja|sort=かま|woodworking}} short for {{m|ja|鎌継ぎ|tr=kamatsugi}}: a [[w:Hammer-headed tenon|hammer-headed tenon]] {{qualifier|from the way the [[sickle]] blade sticks out perpendicular to the handle, similar to the sides of the hammer head on this kind of [[tenon]]}}
# {{lb|ja|sort=かま|slang}} [[excessive]] [[talkativeness]] {{qualifier|probably by sound association with the word {{m|ja|喧しい|tr=yakamashii||noisy}}}}
# {{lb|ja|sort=かま|slang}} an excessively [[talkative]] person
# {{lb|ja|sort=かま|slang}} a [[penis]] {{qualifier|probably from the way that a sickle blade sticks out perpendicular to the handle}}

====Derived terms====
{{der-top}}
* {{ja-l|鎌槍|かまやり|kamayari}}: a kind of [[polearm]] with a [[sickle]]-shaped [[blade]]
* {{ja-l|大鎌|おおがま|ōgama}}: a [[scythe]]
* {{ja-l|鎖鎌|くさりがま|kusarigama}}: a [[sickle]] [[chain]], a kind of [[weapon]]
* {{ja-l|草刈り鎌|くさかりがま|kusakarigama}}: a [[sickle]] for [[mow]]ing [[grass]]
{{der-bottom}}

====Idioms====
{{der-top|Idioms}}
* {{ja-l|鎌が切れる|かまがきれる|kama ga kireru}}: “the sickle cuts well” → to do things with authority, to get things sorted quickly and efficiently, to do things crisply and tidily
* {{ja-l|鎌を掛ける|かまをかける|kama o kakeru}}: “to apply the sickle” → to get something out of a person without them being aware (compare English {{m|en|glean|to glean}}); to [[tempt]] someone, to [[draw]] someone out
* {{ja-l|鎌に掛かる|かまにかかる|kama ni kakaru}}: “to be caught by a sickle” → to be [[taken in]] by someone, to be [[fooled]] or [[tricked]]
{{der-bottom}}
